text: is a former Japanese football player. She played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Kuroda was born on May 8, 1969. She played for Prima Ham FC Kunoichi. She was selected Best Eleven in 1991 season. On January 12, 1989, when Kuroda was 19 years old, she debuted for the Japan national team against Finland. She was a member of Japan for 1991 World Cup. She played at 1989, 1991 AFC Championship, 1990 and 1994 Asian Games. She played 21 games and scored 7 goals for Japan until 1994. ==Statistics== Japan Football Association Japan national team Year Apps Goals 1989 4 6 1990 2 1 1991 11 0 1992 0 0 1993 0 0 1994 4 0 Total 21 7 ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1969 births Category:Living people Category:Japanese footballers Category:Japan women's international footballers Category:Nadeshiko League players Category:Iga FC Kunoichi Mie players Category:1991 FIFA Women's World Cup players Category:1989 AFC Women's Championship players Category:1991 AFC Women's Championship players Category:Footballers at the 1990 Asian Games Category:Footballers at the 1994 Asian Games Category:Asian Games medalists in football Category:Asian Games silver medalists for Japan Category:Medalists at the 1990 Asian Games Category:Medalists at the 1994 Asian Games
title: Kyoko Kuroda
